name: inwardness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality or condition of being inside someone's mind and not expressed to other people: He insulates himself in his inwardness, telling his secret to no-one. The girl's inwardness and remoteness make her difficult to get to know.
More examplesFewer examplesThe problem is that the inwardness of the characters is described, rather than felt.Many of the gestures in her paintings seem to express an inwardness, maybe even a self-protection.They are concerned with what happens to inwardness in a globalized world.
